name: Gemius Tracking Code
author: Erhan Abay

sections.description: The plugin integrates Gemius and WordPress by embedding Gemius tracking code to the pages. You can set different identifiers for home and all other pages from settings page.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the gemius-plugin folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Enter the Gemius Identifier for the site
sections.faq:
What is OO-WordPress?

OO-WordPress is a library that contains components to ease WordPress plugin development. “OO” in the name stands for object-oriented. You can find more information from the project site.

How can I contribute to the project?

Project is hosted on github. If you want to get involved, fork repository, make your changes and send a pull request.

Use issues for your bug reports, feature requests etc.
sections.changelog:
2.2.1

  • Minor refactoring

2.2.0

  • Autoloading managed by Composer again.
  • Vendors updated

2.1.4

Fixed bug: Tracking code added although identifier is not available.

2.1.3

Updates for WordPress plugins directory standarts.

2.1.2

composer.json and documentation related updates.

2.1.1

Autoloading handled with Doctrine\Common\ClassLoader instead of Composer\Autoload\ClassLoader.

2.1.0

Plugin rewritten with OO-WordPress.

2.0.0

First public release.

1.0.0

Initial development release.
